comment: Professor Malos is a good instructor but could benefit from being more engaged with students. A scheduled class time for guidance, especially for those new to programming, would be very helpful. While he provided code skeletons and examples, more direct support or interaction would have improved the overall learning experience.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: Another out of date KSU course, but the professor made the best of it. Really easy course that involved assignments, discussions, and open-book tests.
Great professor, easy class if you do your work on time. Id recommend to anyone! Class consisted of 12 labs, he gave great feedback and was lenient with students if need be. Love!

Rough start due to outdated material and a badly slapped together course (unfortunately standard for KSU's online courses), but Prof. Malos quickly edited modules, made videos, and improved the material as much as he could. I have no doubt he'll improve the course as time goes on. A+ teacher, truly cares about his students and what he is teaching.

Professor Malos is a new professor, but boy is he an improvement and great addition to the IT/CCSE department. He's lenient with due dates (if you have a good reason) and lets you use notes during quizzes/tests/the final. Labs are time-consuming, so be sure to start working on them early in the week.
